agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

site_schedule.name: Home Library Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-2pm -- Book Deliveries: By appointment

site_schedule.name: Computer Literacy Training Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-2pm -- Classes: Offered every other month

site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card, Evergreen card, or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) -- For a resident library card: Living in Union County
Living in Union County -- Homebound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability
Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Liberty in Union County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Liberty in Union County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Liberty in Union County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Union County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Union County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Fri 8:30am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Fri 8:30am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services for older adults.
service_description: Provides door-to-door, wheelchair-accessible transportation for persons in Fayette, Franklin, Rush, Union, and Wayne County. In-state medical appointment transportation is available for appointments as far as Indianapolis. Reservations must be scheduled in advance. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to make arrangements at least 48 hours in advance of appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in or have a transportation destination in Union or rural Wayne County
Age 55 or older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Union County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Union County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Union County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Union County
To visit: Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families.
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families.
site_details: Call for enrollment information.
site_eligibility: Open -- Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age 3 -- Household income at or below 100% Federal Poverty Level
Open -- Age 3-5 years-old (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Union County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Union County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open
Low income homeowners or mobile home occupants

agency_name: UNION COUNTY COLLEGE CORNER JOINT SCHOOL DISTRICT
agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
site_name: UNION COUNTY COLLEGE CORNER JOINT SCHOOL DISTRICT
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and tains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Living in Union County
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County
Varies by service; call for details.
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Living in Union County -- Age 6 months or older
Open; serves Union County
Varies by service; serves Union County
Living in Union County -- Without health insurance -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level
Living within the county

Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Union County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Union County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Union County

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based organization providing food and clothing pantries.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, hygiene supplies, and paper products to those in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: General Clothing Provision
site_schedule.schedule: Thurs 10am-2pm (10-noon Union County residents; noon-2 non-Union County residents)

site_eligibility: Living in Union County -- Limit two (2) visits per month
Open

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Union County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Union County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Victims and witnesses of crimes in Union County
Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.
Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in this county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Varies by service; serves Union County

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Calculates tax rates based on the budget set by the County Council each year; pays the county's bills; assists property owners in filing exemptions and tracking land transfers.
service_description: Calculates rates on taxable property in Union County, and assists property owners in filing exemptions and tracking land transfers.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Union County

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers in Union County and portions of Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Randolph, and Wayne counties.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Union County and portions of Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Randolph, and Wayne counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Randolph, Union, and Wayne counties

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees court cases involving Union County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: Union County juveniles age 17 or younger
Offenders assigned to probation by the Union County Circuit Court
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Union County   -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Union County   -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Union County
